asia.name: Mount Everest
asia.fact: Mount Everest grows approximately 44 millimeters every year

asia.name: Mount K2
asia.fact: K2 is the second-highest mountain on Earth

asia.name: Mount Kangchenjunga
asia.fact: The Kangchenjunga is the second least climbed peak of the 14 peaks over 8,000 meters (26,247 feet)

asia.name: Mount Lhotse
asia.fact: Lhotse is the fourth highest peak in the world and lies just south of Mount Everest.

asia.name: Mount Makalu
asia.fact: Makalu is fifth-tallest mountain in the whole world.

africa.name: Mount Kilimanjaro
africa.fact: Mount Kilimanjaro is the highest freestanding mountain in the world.

africa.name: Mount Kenya
africa.fact: Mount Kenya is an extinct volcano which originally rose an estimated 3 million years ago and last erupted an estimated 2.6 million years ago.

africa.name: Mount Stanley
africa.fact: The African Rift Systems Mt. Stanley is a fault-block mountain that rises between two rifts in the region.

africa.name: Mount Meru
africa.fact: Meru's summit is rocky and barren, its slopes are highly fertile, with many streams and thick forests.

africa.name: Mount Simien
africa.fact: it is home to globally threatened species, including the iconic Walia ibex, a wild mountain goat found nowhere else in the world, the Gelada baboon and the Ethiopian wolf.

northamerica.name: Mount McKinley
northamerica.fact: The native Koyukon Athabascan people call the mountain Denali, which is usually translated as The Great One.

northamerica.name: Mount Logan
northamerica.fact: Mount Logan is the source of the Hubbard and Logan glaciers.

northamerica.name: Pico de Orizaba
northamerica.fact: The volcano sits about 120 miles east of Mexico City and is visible from nearly 70 miles away.

northamerica.name: Mount Saint Elias
northamerica.fact: Mount Saint Elias the first part of the North American mainland to be seen by Russian explorers.

northamerica.name: Mount Popocatepetl
northamerica.fact: It is the 2nd highest volcano in North America and the 5th highest peak in North America.

southamerica.name: Mount Aconcagua
southamerica.fact: Aconcagua is one of the Seven Summits, the highest peaks on each of the seven continents. It is second in height after Mount Everest.

southamerica.name: Mount Ojos del Salado
southamerica.fact: The highest active volcano in the world, it towers over the altiplano at a breath-taking 22,615 ft.

southamerica.name: Mount Huayna Potosi
southamerica.fact: Huayna Potosi is a complex mountain with a number of sub peaks.

southamerica.name: Mount Cotopaxi
southamerica.fact: Cotopaxi National Park Sits on the Longest Road in the World.

southamerica.name: Mount El Misti
southamerica.fact: El Misti is a Stratovolcano, with its symmetrical cone shape.  It has different layers caused by ash and pyroclastic flows.

europe.name: Mount Elbrus
europe.fact: Mt. Elbrus is the highest point in the world a vehicle has ever accessed!

europe.name: Mount Dykh-Tau
europe.fact: Famous for its technical difficulty and frequent avalanches, it's a huge challenge for any climber.

europe.name: Mount Shkhara
europe.fact: Shkhara is the high point and the eastern anchor of a massif known as the Bezingi (or Bezengi) Wall, a 12 kilometers (7 mi) long ridge.

europe.name: Mount Koshtan-Tau
europe.fact: Koshtan-Tau is the highest peak (5,144m) of the Koshtan massif of the central Caucasus Mountains in the Kabardino-Balkaria Republic of Russia.

europe.name: Mount Kazbek
europe.fact: The site of mount kazbek imprisonment was in a cave called Betlemi, which later became an Orthodox hermitage.

australia.name: Mount Kosciuszko
australia.fact: The Kosciuszko National Park was declared as a World Biosphere Reserve in 1997 by UNESCO.

australia.name: Mount Townsend
australia.fact: Mount Townsend has a craggier peak and is arguably more dominant than the relatively round-topped.

australia.name: Mount Twynam
australia.fact: The mountain is large but unimposing and has good and far-reaching views over Blue Lake Cirque and the Western Falls.

australia.name: Mount Rams Head
australia.fact: The mountain attracts hikers in the summer, and during the winter months is covered with snow for back country skiers and alpine touring.

australia.name: Unnamed peak on Etheridge Ridge
australia.fact: An elevation standing high above the surrounding area with small summit area, steep slopes and local relief of 300m or more.
